New Records: India scored 196 runs in their innings, their highest score in the tournament.
Bangladesh scored 146 runs in their innings, their second-highest score in the tournament.
Hardik Pandya hit a half-century (27 balls) for India, his highest score in the tournament.
Kuldeep Yadav took 3 wickets for India, his best performance in the tournament so far.
Key Match Events: India won by 50 runs after Bangladesh were all out for 146 runs in 20 overs.
Bangladesh's Mahmudullah and Shanto contributed with 24 and 40 runs respectively in the middle order.
Key moments included Hardik Pandya's sixes and Kuldeep Yadav's effective bowling performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and opted to bowl first, aiming to restrict India to a small total.
India's batting coach Vikram Rathour highlighted the importance of Virat Kohli's form and the middle order's contribution.
The match was played at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua, with favorable conditions for batting.
Post-Match Reflections: India's players celebrated their victory, with Hardik Pandya and Virat Kohli acknowledging the team's effort.
Bangladesh's players expressed disappointment but praised the team's fight despite the loss.
The win moved India closer to the semifinals, with the coach emphasizing the importance of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw several sixes, with Hardik Pandya and Shanto contributing significantly with boundary hits.
The highest PowerPlay score for India in the tournament was 53 runs in the first six overs.
Bangladesh's bowlers struggled with the PowerPlay, allowing India to take control early.
Others: The match was part of the T20 World Cup 2024 Super Eight stage, with implications for both teams' progression.
